item.description:
Lets earn some good elevation gain and get a good workout for our legs on Sunday morning. For all those of us who have obligations later in the day and can't head to the mountains.

What we will do:
Use the steps and seats of the 37 sections of the stadium to run/walk up and down, and up and down, and up and down,... One tour (heading up and down all 37 sections once) adds to approx. 1.2mi, approx. 40% uphill, 40% downhill, 20% flat as you walk from section to section, as measured by another runner. Good timesÂ 

Everybody can go at his/her own pace to get a great workout, and we can cheer each other on across the sections. Every time I have been there many locals were working out; it is a great atmosphere as strangers root for one another.

On-street parking as well as free parking right at the stadium (as you drive in through the gates around the stadium). Only one entrance into the stadium is open --> you have to walk up some stairs and you arrive in section 1. We will meet right there in Section 1.

I will be starting my workout at 7:30am sharp. I will be there approx. 10minutes early to 'meet and greet' all of you. Should you be arriving past 7:30am, yell my name, and I will 'wave' from another section.

My goal is to complete 2 full sections, mixing using the seats and steps 50/50. I hope to complete this in less than 1.5hours without break.

Some background on what this meetup will be like:
http://news.harvard.edu/gazette/story/2012/04/building-endurance-step-by-step/

http://november-project.com/stadium/
(you can watch the video to get a sense of the steepness of the steps)

Directions to the Stadium as provided by official website:
http://www.gocrimson.com/directions/index

What you need to bring:
-something to drink
-possibly dress in layers (weather dependent)
-possibly a sweat towel
I am not sure whether an evening event will occur on Saturday evening. If so, then the Stadium will be cleaned that morning and you canNOT leave your water bottle and/or jacket in one section; then you will need to carry your belongings with you. (Last weekend the cleaning crew was busy cleaning after a football game; they are awesome guys, stepping out of your way as you are running up and down, respecting our workouts in their workspace; but they will clean EVERYTHING; it was the only time a cleaning crew was in the Stadium thus far when I was there, so I say the odds are low; when they are not, you can leave your belongings in one place.)
